name: Nancy

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Kathleen's place was exactly what I needed to recharge after driving from Long Island. It was peaceful, comfortable and pretty, inside and out, with several decks overlooking the creek. I loved the interior of the cabin, and it was perfectly clean. The adjustable bed, complete with massager, was incredible! Kathleen went above and beyond to give the cabin special touches. Arriving to calming jazz was wonderful and began a relaxing first evening. I mostly stayed at the house because it was so enjoyable, but I also enjoyed hiking some of the less popular area trails like Poor Mountain Preserve which offered a spectacular overlook very soon into the trail. The long staircase from the road to the house felt like a lot upon arrival in pouring rain, but I loved it on the way out - a great workout! I enjoyed being surrounded by nature - felt much further from the main road than it was! Kathleen was quick to answer questions and very hospitable and helpful. I'm glad I chose this spot!

The kitchen and bathroom were fully equipped with the essentials and Kathleen and Billy responded immediately to a minor issue which resolved within minutes. We could not have asked for a better retreat to the Blue Ridge! Weâ€™ll definitely be back for a future getaway!

I have stayed at the Falling Pines Cabin many times. Not only is the location amazing (feel like you are in the middle of nowhere but right around the corner there is everything you need...grocery, pharmacy, restaurants, etc.) but the ambiance and beauty of the place is unparalleled. The cabin is always spotless when I arrive and there was even classical music playing when I entered. I enjoy sleeping with the Master balcony door open to fall asleep to the sounds of the creek and the evening.
I had an accident off site and ended up with a broken rib from it. I let them know and they checked on me daily and even took out the trash for me! I love Kathleen and Billy, very kind and super hosts! The adjustable bed was perfect for 5 days of rest. Unfortunately, I didn't get to accomplish what I came to VA for (my elderly parents nearby) but it was almost like a vacay anyway just to recover in the cabin.
There are still wonderful people in the world. They are some of the best!

review_text:
Our trip to Falling Pines Historic Cabin was wonderful! It was peaceful and relaxing. Kathleen and Billy were excellent, thoughtful hosts. We were greeted with a personal note and cookies- a warm welcome after the drive to get to the cabin. The cabin is located not far outside of Roanoke, but felt like we were in the quiet of the woods up the mountainside. The three decks provided ample outdoor space, which we could enjoy in the unusually warm winter days. The babbling brook is so peaceful and we really enjoyed the views every day from the many windows in the living room. We used the full kitchen to our advantage, cooking all are meals and using the grill. All the basic kitchen pans/gadgets/cutlery were available to use, and of course, the essential wine glasses. The bed was super comfortable, and the bedding soft. We loved staying in this historical cabin and would definitely stay here again. Kathleen and Billy were easily reachable and answered any questions we had before and during our stay. You will not regret your stay there!
Though our primary goal was hibernation and relaxation, we did venture out for a fabulous hike on Dragon's Tooth in Catawba, about a 30 minute drive. It's a 5 mile out-and-back hike, decent difficulty, and fantastic views.

review_text: My husband and I had delayed taking a summer vacation this year and decided to make it a fall getaway instead. We were looking for a comfortable place to get out of the city and enjoy the outdoors. Kathleen and Billy's cabin was absolutely perfect! They have thought of every last detail to make you feel at home, including welcoming us with delicious cookies and soft sounds of jazz. This year, in particular, I was concerned about staying in a place that was freshly cleaned and I was not disappointed. The cabin was spotless and had had a thorough cleaning before our arrival. We hiked McAfee Knob, Dragon's Tooth, and the Star trail at Mill Mountain Park while we were there and all were an easy 20-30 min. drive from the cabin. Our favorite part of the cabin was the THREE outdoor decks which overlook the creek and make it easy to enjoy the wonderful wooded setting surrounding the cabin. The kitchen is very well stocked and we had no problem making all of our dinners while staying there. A week in this cabin was exactly what we needed and I'm sure we will be back again!

Unfortunately, it was extremely cold and snowy the weekend we visited, so that limited how much time we spent exploring. But it ended up working out great because being inside was so relaxing. We had no complaints - the couch was comfortable, we could spread out and enjoy movies and TV and watch the snow fall. We would absolutely stay here again!

name: Charles

Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Came to check out the Roanoke area as a place to retire. We live in Chicago and Amtrak started daily service to DC so, we could easily go for a week if we wanted to see a show or exhibit. Corey's place was just a short walk from the station and since the train normally gets in at 10:30pm the location was ideal.
In the morning the location was even better. A short walk to breakfast and then to the farmer's market. Even with the rain we strolled around the area talking to shop owners, walked along the river, and to Elmwood Park.
The apartment was wonderful. Everything I expected from the listing. I did leave a dim light on to light the (two) stairs to the bathroom as a precaution. We didn't really do any cooking as we wanted to eat out and experience downtown on the only night we were in Roanoke.
If I was coming to the area for an extended visit and wanted a place near some great hiking, road or mountain biking that had a decent restaurants and nightlife, I'd stay at Corey's again.

review_text:
I really debated on a 4 star vs 5 star rating for one reason. THE NOISE. I heard every step my neighbors took (the floors in my place and theirs's squeaked with every single step), I heard every word they said, EVERYTHING. At one point the floors were squeaking so much, I blocked the bedroom door to make sure no one was coming into the room I was sleeping in. The walls must have been made with newspaper. If you want a quiet undisturbed night of sleep this is NOT the place for you. If you just need a bed for a night and don't mind the noise this is a perfect spot.
Everything else about this stay was amazing. Corey was very proactive and even had a small gift card waiting for me to a brewery I was already going on. The room was super nice. The bed was comfy with tons of pillows. The bathroom was clean and had good toilet paper which is nice. The place and parking was a little confusing to find but I just parked in the parking garage next door for $8 a day.

review_text:
Corey was most attentive host we have encountered. Examples: we needed an extra day after the original booking and Corey obliged immediately, this move involved a need for luggage storage which Corey provided, personal recommendations for restaurants and events, and finally an unanticipated change of unit was painlessly navigated.
Beyond these larger issues his attention to the smallest details was exemplary. Immaculate rooms, breakfast beverages provided, hair dryers, irons, even tooth picks and cleaning supplies provided.
The only caveat we would offer has nothing to do with Corey. The gorgeous wooden floors, which appear to have been retained from the building conversion, are â€œcreakyâ€ and the walls are apparently quite thin. This may be problematic for light sleepers. We used a white noise machine.
Coreyâ€™s attention to both large and small details will keep us returning.

We walked to Big Lick Brewing & we ordered our meal from the Burger place next door & they delivered the food to our spot & the bar for free! The food was delicious too! Then we walked back to the apartment & shot a few games of pool for a while which was a lot of fun!!

name: LeAnn
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our time here and would readily recommend it. But here are a few tips if you stay here:
1. If the kitchen faucet suddenly loses pressure, press the toggle switch on the nozzle and you'll get a full stream again.
2. Bring along a white noise machine or ear plugs in case someone is staying on the second level.
3. If the occupants of the other unit don't park far enough forward in the drive, simply drive around the block to the alley and park in the back. The keypads on the back door (off the deck) are same as the front.
4. If you don't want water everywhere in the bathroom, simply put a bath sheet on the floor under the clear glass wall and aim the rain shower head away from the tub.
5. If you are staying here in winter, the bathroom will feel colder than the rest of the house, but the toilet seat is heated!
6. Last (but not a "tip"): the bed is quite soft.
This really was a great place to stay. Just follow my tips to make it better!

Stayed about a week
review_text:
This was the most relaxing trip we've ever been on. We came out to celebrate our anniversary/ take our honeymoon and we could not have been more pleased. When we came in the windows were open, letting in the fresh air and babbling brook sounds from the backyard. Peaceful music was playing on the Alexa in the kitchen. We weren't there for 10 minutes and the relaxing had begun.
Everything about the cabin was amazing. There were abundant windows to let in the fresh mountain air. The creek in the back was home to ducks aplenty, and a great blue heron we had fun looking for each morning.
Lucy left breakfast for us, and stopped by a few days later with more! She was respectful of our time and space and was gone before we even knew she was there. And the food was AMAZING. If she leaves you a frittata, eat it! It was delicious!
Last but certainly not least, that bathtub. I told my husband no less than 4 times that we need one of those. Already thinking of renting next year! 100/10

My favorite part was constantly being surprised by a new discovery in each room and outside. Lucy has created the most unique airbnb we have ever visited. We slept with the windows open - felt like we were camping but with luxurious bedding. And - We were visited by a Heron on the rocks below the porch - watching him hunt up close was very special. We sat and talked about every nook and cranny that has been thoughtfully crafted and is generously shared. Lucy prepared a wonderful breakfast of fresh fruit, frittatas and danishes, so appreciated. We wish we had more time. A great memory with our VT daughter. Thank you!

The views from all windows, the deck, the fire pit, were all incredible. You can expect to see a plethora of squirrels, chipmunks, fish, deer, and ducks! We could have sat with the binoculars all day, played the games she provided, or just simply lounged around the cabin. It was the perfect place to spend our babymoon and where we also got engaged (yay!). We cannot thank Lucy enough for letting us experience her lovely home.

I just retired after over 35 years of teaching high school, and I wanted a fairy tale refuge where I could sit in silence and beauty. Lucyâ€™s place did that and so much more. I sat by the babbling brook and read and watched all the wildlife going about their peaceful lives. I sat in the coziest of chairs and listened to the running water just outside the window. A close drive to Roanoke, I went on hikes and strolled along the Roanoke greenway path. Lucy provided the most delicious home-baked goods and I felt like I had my own personal nana making sure I was fed and comfortable. The space was decorated with impeccable taste. And the nights! Oh my. Sleeping in that cozy bed, listening to the creek outside the windowâ€¦well, I never wanted to leave. Thank you, Lucy, for creating and sharing your piece of paradise with us all.

In the description Lucy says convenient to everything but feels miles away, that was so accurate! The cottage is a gem. sitting out on.the porch and listening to the creek was relaxing.
The house is full of surprises and knick knacks it was like living in a fairy garden or a magic shop. You could walk from room to room and never get bored and you will always see something new. Delightful.

name: Linda

review_text:
This unique, quirky cabin was built in 1939 as a fishing cabin. The rafters and beams are constructed of repurposed box cars -you can still see the commercial printing on the wood.
We enjoyed a few nights here with a lovely view of Back Creek whose tumbling water filled the cabin with soothing sounds. The tranquil melody of the creek helped us drift off to sleep each night. Off the deck in the distance, we saw a bear cub and Herons. In the mornings we saw loads of ducks swimming.
Entering the cabin is like stepping into another in time. Most of the living space is on the main floor with a small upstairs "attic" bedroom, which has its own charm. The house is beautifully decorated, filled with unusual itemsâ€”many dealing with fairies, tree spirits and wood nymphs- your eye never rests as you sit in the living room and try to take it all in.
Lucy is an ideal host. She left us muffins, fruits and a 'frittata'--a quiche-like dish. Food enough for several days. She was available to answer any questions- yet gave us complete privacy.
We really savored this idyllic cottage where you can just rest, relax and experience the joys of nature.

review_text:
Lucy's place is bursting with charm and filled with hidden touches and artistic delights! I think we could have stayed a week and still found new treasures to see, hear, taste, and touch.
The cabin's location is perfect - overlooking and just steps away from Crystal Creek. We sat on the deck and watched a whole family of ducks fish and sunbathe on the rocks. We were also graced by Lucy's Blue Heron, who came to feed in the early morning hours, as well as after dinner. I only wish I had brought my watercolors - I would have loved to paint him!
Lucy made us feel like family - leaving delicious homemade goodies to welcome us. There are binoculars to birdwatch, wood for the firepit, s'more making supplies, games, books, and so much more! The pantry and cabinets are fully stocked with anything you might need to prepare a meal, and Kroger (surprisingly!) is only minutes away. The bed linens are the softest I have ever felt. My daughter even remarked on their luxury.
When we walked through the front door we felt magic, and that feeling stayed with us until we locked up and left. Featured in several books, magazines, and newspapers, Lucy's cabin MUST be experienced first hand.

review_text: My best friend and I stayed 17-20 February 2022 to celebrate my birthday. I truly cannot say enough good things about this place. The host, Lucy, was really great about responding quickly to pre-trip questions. The cabin is easy to find via GPS. Upon arrival we were blown away by the decor and all the fabulous food treats Lucy left. She even left me birthday balloons! The cabin is perfectly situated right next to the creek, and the sound of the flowing water added to the magical feel. It is well appointed, with plenty of towels, soap, blankets, etc. As gals that like to cook, let me tell you, this place is fully stocked with everything you might need to prepare meals. The beds were comfy, there is central heat and a wood burning fireplace, as well as a fire pit down near the creek. This place afforded us such a wonderful, comfortable and cozy spot to relax and catch up. Additionally, although you might feel like you are deep in the back woods, shopping and dining options are actually a short drive away. We had a great visit and would LOVE to come again!!

review_text: This little cabin is quite unique! We had a very relaxing week "glamping" here while visiting Roanoke. It is in a quiet location on a back road, but just a few minutes' drive to the grocery store and restaurants. Wifi is fine for teleworking, and we were able to stream a movie with no problem. The cabin was quite clean and well-equipped. The deck overlooking the creek is especially nice: we loved having wine and cheese dinners out there and watching the wildlife (deer, lots of ducks, turtles, a big heron). The main bedroom is quite comfortable as well. We were there during a heat wave, and the AC more or less kept up. The one caveat I will add is that the upstairs loft is much warmer than the rest of the house (which I expected, from the photos) and the mattress up there is saggy and uncomfortable (which I did not expect). So I can't say as I slept all that well. But apart from that, we really enjoyed our time in the magical cabin!

True statement! This will be a yearly (or twice a year if i can pull it off) thing for us for sure. Be blessed.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This apartment was such a sweet little treat! I needed a clean, quiet place to crash in Roanoke for a few days for a work thing, and Corey's listing fit the bill exactly. I knew there'd be big windows and nice light, etc, but I wasn't expecting such a sweeping view of downtown, nor to arrive in the middle of a small snowstorm! Corey was kind enough to allow me to check in a bit early, so by the time the snow really started to fall, I was already nestled in safe and sound with a mug of hot tea, watching the city turn white below. The apartment was spotless and tastefully furnished, and there were a number of thoughtful touches that made the stay extra special: bags of popcorn in the cabinet, a gift certificate to a local brewery, Netflix with its own airbnb account, and even mints on a fresh pile of folded towels. The location is perfectly walkable to all the downtown shops and spots to eat, and my husband joined me for a little date night. Thank you so much, Corey, we'll be back soon!

The apt is SUPER well equipped with classy touches like make up removal wipes, coffee, teas, chocolate, extra chargers, etc. The massage chair was a blessing after a long day of hiking while taking advantage of the many streaming services. Corey was more than happy to provide hiking and restaurant recommendations, logistical clarifications and he saved the day (well night) when I cleverly locked myself out of the apt. The complex is a funky renovation of an older building which translates to a charming unit - giant windows with beautiful city views, classic wood floors and a little bit of noise - but only during the day. Overall, the place was spotless, comfortable and the location and free parking are convenient. I plan on coming back and plan to stay with Corey again. I highly recommend this Airbnb and this host.

review_text:
Location: 100% Perfect location, we couldn't have found a better spot right in the middle of downtown. Excellent view, we loved watching the sunsets. We had zero issues finding a parking space. It's important to mention thought that the apartment is above a nightclub in an old building with thin walls and creaky floors. We could hear the music downstairs until 11 or 12:30 Thurs-Sat nights. We could also hear every conversation and every step the neighbors made. The HVAC unit was pretty loud too. So if you're looking for total silence, this is not the place!
Bed: Comfy king with plenty of pillows.
Amenities: Filtered water in the fridge was a bonus.
Bath: Low water pressure in the shower but the water got blazing hot super fast. Lotsa clean towels and plenty of toilet paper.

review_text: This property was extremely dog friendly, with a fully fenced yard, dog food and water bowls, and a box of dog toys. Location is very close to Tanglewood Mall and many restaurants, grocery stores, and other retail; however, its location off the beaten path feels very private, despite being so close to shopping and Rte 581. There are also several good, moderate hikes in the Blue Ridge mountains within easy driving distance. The cabin is well appointed, particularly the outdoor spaces. A huge outdoor deck includes a gas fire pit, lots of comfortable seating, a large shade umbrella, an outdoor dining table, and a large gas grill. The yard includes a wood fire pit. While this cabin feels private and worked well for us, note that there is a freight rail line very close by and a road directly behind the property that is pretty busy. It didn't really bother us, but to be clear to any other renters, you're not going to be in a quiet natural spot. Overall, great value and experience.

review_text:
We enjoyed staying at the cabin M-Saturday during our vacation. The cabin was homey and comfortable and having a kitchen and laundry on site was really helpful while traveling with children. The location was quiet and we felt very secluded during our stay which was really nice.
My only feedback is that it would be great to install grab bars by the toilet for wheelchair users or those with mobility aides or physical disabilities to safely use the toilet. Also, the shower stall is unfortunately, not a roll-in shower and wasn't wide enough to accommodate a standard wheelchair width. My husband was able to use it with my help if I propped up his back wheel on the lip and helped him get in, but it would not be possible for him to use this independently in his chair without help and without sticking out a bit. It would be great to swap out the stall for a wider one or one without a lip entirely so a wheelchair user could wheel in independently.

review_text: The cabin overall was cute and the hosts answer pretty quickly and have extra amenities like towels and such which is nice, but the fact that the cabin is listed under dog friendly with a fully enclosed yard is not accurate. The fence is mostly enclosed with a gap between the side of the cabin and where the fence ends that was big enough for my 50 lb medium sized dog to fit through and escape when we let her out to pee. Thank god we found her but we werenâ€™t able to let her outside again without a leash for the rest of the trip out of the fear it would happen again. The hole is to the right of the door (if looking from outside) where the fence meets the cabin. The roof also unfortunately leaked onto my husbandâ€™s head while we slept (in the bedroom next to the living room on the right side of the bed). Otherwise the location is nice and quiet with a great view of the stars and a creek and is only 15-20 mins from downtown spots for food. Please be wary if bringing pets.

My sister and I loved how beautiful and homey this was along with being so pet friendly for my Lab and her pug. I loved sitting by the water and reading (the rest of the week was beautiful- especially being from NY). The fence is priceless, the beds were so comfy and despite the short time we didnâ€™t have water (nothing you can do about it!) everything was perfect. My sister worked from the cabin and had no trouble with the internet, there were plenty of snacks and even beautiful dishes and pans. When our parents came over to visit we even played games together.Thank you so much for having this place for when we bring our dogs and are visiting family in Roanoke!

We found the space comfortable and extremely clean. The dining room table made the perfect spot to play cards. We made several meals at home and found the kitchen to be well supplied. One thing we really appreciated were the nightlights throughout the space and clocks by the beds. Both bedrooms and the living room had televisions, so everyone was happy! The low couch could be an issue for someone with leg issues, but there's a good armchair in the living room. The wifi was fast. Anna was a responsive hostess.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Great location for our weekend in Roanoke to see a performance at Roanoke Ballet Theatre! The dance studios in Grandin Village are a very short drive (walkable, but we were a little nervous about walking home in the dark with no sidewalk and cars zooming over the hill near the house). The park across the street was a great place to let our dog run and chase balls.
We appreciate all the thoughtful touches - snacks for us AND our dog, a big box of dog toys, blackout curtains in the bedroom, comfy furniture. Plenty of room to put our dogâ€™s crate in either the living room or dining room.
The spacious kitchen is well-equipped, although with so many great places to eat nearby, we barely used it. Bathroom was so stocked with necessities that I barely unpacked my toiletries bagâ€¦very nice shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, hand soap. Plenty of towels, and great lighting!
Anna was very communicative with check-in instructions and immediately responsive to any questions we had.
Weâ€™ll be back!

review_text: Anna & Emma are such terrific hosts! We were SO happy with our stay at their home and their thoughtful communication and little touches made it that much better. The house was so cozy and clean, had more than enough room, includes laundry, 3 flatscreen TVs each with streaming, comfortable beds, and I especially loved the shampoo, conditioner and body wash dispensers mounted on the shower wall - that body wash is especially amazing - my boyfriend agrees! The location of the house is IDEAL - there are neighbors nearby but they are not right against you, the neighborhood itself is super safe and within walking distance to markets, restaurants and the â€œhippieâ€ district which was right up our alley. We stayed there during Thanksgiving week so the weather was pretty cold, and when we arrived at the house the heater was already turned on which was such a thoughtful (and much appreciated) touch. There was also coffee, sweet treats, and all the basics we needed in the well-stocked kitchen. We didnâ€™t bring our dog on this trip, but he would have loved it there, and we noticed all the doggie treats & toys that were available for those that bring their canine companion. Check in & check out was super easy and on our own time which was great, and I knew that if we needed anything at all, we could send a message to our hosts and they would respond right away. I could not recommend Anna, Emma and the Biking Dog House more! We have family close by so we will definitely be staying there again!
